abstract.text: Instantiates and returns a document query.

legalNotices.copyright: Copyright © 2025 Apple Inc. All rights reserved.

inlineContent.text: The type of document to search for. For a list of supported document types, see Document Type Identifier in
A predicate that limits the results returned by the query. Pass
to receive all the documents of the specified type.
The maximum number of samples returned by the query. If you want to return all matching samples, use
An array of sort descriptors that specify the order of the results returned by this query. Pass
if you don’t need the results in a specific order.
HealthKit defines a number of sort identifiers (for example,
). Use the sort descriptors you create with these identifiers only in queries. You cannot use them to perform an in-memory sort of an array of samples.
Pass
to include the full document data. Pass
to just receive a summary of the document. For CDA documents, the summary includes the title, the patient’s name, the author’s name, and the custodian’s name.
Since the full document data can be quite large, only pass
when you need to access the full document’s data.

A block that is called each time a new batch of documents is available. The document query returns its results incrementally in batches. The results handler may be called multiple times each time the query is executed.
This block takes the following parameters:
A reference to the query calling this block.
query
An array containing the samples returned by this query, or
if an error occurred.
results
A Boolean value that indicates whether the query is done. If

, the query is complete, and it will not call the results handler again. Otherwise, the query will call the results handler at least one more time, as soon as the next batch of documents is available.
done
If an error occurs, this parameter contains an object describing the error; otherwise, it is
error
A newly initialized document query object.
After you instantiate the query, call the
class’s

method to run it. Queries run on an anonymous background queue. As soon as the query is complete, the results handler is executed on the same background queue (but not necessarily on the same thread). You typically dispatch these results to the main queue to update the user interface.

abstract.text: A false value.
A true value.
Access and share health and fitness data while maintaining the user’s privacy and control.
A query that returns a snapshot of all matching documents currently saved in the HealthKit store.
Instantiates and returns a document query.
An abstract class that represents a health document in the HealthKit store.
A sample type used to create queries for documents.
The access point for all data managed by HealthKit.
Starts executing the provided query.
A value indicating that the query returns all the matching samples in the HealthKit store.
A constant for sorting samples based on their start date.
Type to represent a Boolean value.
Information about an error condition including a domain, a domain-specific error code, and application-specific information.
A definition of logical conditions for constraining a search for a fetch or for in-memory filtering.
An immutable description of how to order a collection of objects according to a property common to all the objects.
A value type whose instances are either `true` or `false`.
A signed integer value type.
The return type of functions that don’t explicitly specify a return type, that is, an empty tuple `()`.
A type representing an error value that can be thrown.
